data.enText: a line or surface that bends gradually; a smooth bend
the delicate curve of her ear

data.chText: 直线与曲线交织的图案
data.enText: a pattern of straight lines and curves

data.chText: 司机在拐弯处失控，撞在了一棵树上。
data.enText: The driver lost control on a curve and the vehicle hit a tree.
to plot a curve on a graph
the unemployment-income curve (= a line on a graph showing the relationship between the number of unemployed people and national income)
a ball that moves in a curve when it is thrown to the batter

data.chText: 一名记者向那位参议员提出了一个出乎意料的难题。
data.enText: One of the journalists threw the senator a curve (= surprised him by asking a difficult question) .
to move or make sth move in the shape of a curve; to be in the shape of a curve

data.chText: 那条路沿海湾呈曲线伸展。
data.enText: The road curved around the bay.
The ball curved through the air.
His lips curved in a smile.

ex.chText: º120º的弧
ex.enText: an arc of 120

ex.chText: 虹在天空中形成了一个美丽的弧。
ex.enText: The rainbow formed a beautiful arc in the sky.

ex.chText: 看起来太阳在天空中的运行轨迹呈弧形。
ex.enText: The sun appears to move in an arc across the sky.

synonyms.bx: 指几何学中的弧，也指弧形或弧线。

ex.chText: 那个拱的跨度为70米。
ex.enText: That arch has a span of 70 metres.

ex.chText: 她打算去凯旋门游玩。
ex.enText: She was going to visit the Triumphal Arch.

ex.chText: 他嘴唇的弧形曲线很迷人。
ex.enText: The bow of his lips is very attractive.

ex.chText: 那个小孩想知道为什么虹为弓形。
ex.enText: The child wanted to know why the rainbow is in a bow shape.

synonyms.bx: 指弯曲的形状或呈弓形的物体。

ex.chText: 楼梯呈优美的曲线上升。
ex.enText: The stairs ascended in a graceful curve.

ex.chText: 路上有个急转弯的地段。
ex.enText: There is a sharp curve in the road.

synonyms.bx: 含义最广，指任何带有弧度的线条或曲线状物。

ex.chText: 那个工人把一根金属丝弯成一个圆圈。
ex.enText: The worker bends a piece of wire into a ring.

ex.chText: 那个小男孩想知道铜为什么容易弯折。
ex.enText: That little boy wonders why copper bends easily.

synonyms.bx: 指通过外力的作用使某物弯曲。

ex.chText: 狮子拱起后背向鹿扑去。
ex.enText: The lion arched its back to jump on the deer.

ex.chText: 树在人行道上方形成了一个拱顶。
ex.enText: Two rows of trees arched over the sidewalk.

synonyms.bx: 指身体某部位拱起或某物朝某方向拱起。

ex.chText: 树枝被大雪压弯了。
ex.enText: The branches were bowed by the heavy snow.

ex.chText: 树木被风吹弯了腰。
ex.enText: The trees bowed in the wind.

ex.chText: 她向客人深深地鞠了一躬。
ex.enText: She bowed deeply to her guest.

ex.chText: 他羞愧地低下了头。
ex.enText: He bowed his head in shame.

synonyms.bx: 指某物在外力的作用下发生弯曲；用于人时，常表示鞠躬或由于羞愧而低头。

ex.chText: 蛇盘绕在树上。
ex.enText: The snake coiled around the tree.

ex.chText: 他把铁丝盘了起来。
ex.enText: He coiled the wire.

synonyms.bx: 强调卷绕或盘绕成环形。

ex.chText: 马路弯向左边。
ex.enText: The road curved to the left.

ex.chText: 他咧嘴笑了。
ex.enText: A smile curved his lips.

synonyms.bx: 指某物沿曲线运动或呈曲线形。

tr: a pitch of a baseball that is thrown with spin so that its path curves as it approaches the batter
curved segment (of a road or river or railroad track etc.)
the property possessed by the curving of a line or surface
a line on a graph representing data
the trace of a point whose direction of motion changes
form a curl, curve, or kink
example: the cigar smoke curled up at the ceiling
The car cut to the left at the intersection
The motorbike veered to the right
The road winds around the lake
the path twisted through the forest

value.def: A curve is a smooth, gradually bending line, for example part of the edge of a circle.
If something curves, or if someone or something curves it, it has the shape of a curve.

example.ex: The track curved away below him.
example.tran: 他脚下的小径蜿蜒地伸向远方。

example.ex: ...a knife with a slightly curving blade...
A small, unobtrusive smile curved the cook's thin lips.
example.tran: 厨师的薄唇一弯，露出一丝不易察觉的微笑。

value.def: If something curves, it moves in a curve, for example through the air.

example.ex: The ball curved strangely in the air.
example.tran: 球在空中划出一道奇异的弧线。

value.def: You can refer to a change in something as a particular curve, especially when it is represented on a graph.

example.ex: Each firm will face a downward-sloping demand curve...
example.tran: 每一家企业都将面临需求曲线的下滑。

example.ex: Was it just a temporary blip on an otherwise healthy growth curve?
example.tran: 这是否是原本良好的增长曲线中暂时的偏离？

value.tran: (尤指用图表表示的)曲线变化

value.def: If someone throws you a curve or if they throw you a curve ball, they surprise you by doing something you do not expect.

example.ex: At the last minute, I threw them a curve ball by saying, 'We're going to bring spouses'.
example.tran: 在最后一刻，我给他们出了一个难题，说：“我们要带家属来。”

value.tran: 使惊奇;使感到意外;给…出难题
